intro: Lonicera gynochlamydea subsp. dapanshanensis, commonly known as the Dapanshan honeysuckle, is a rare shrub native to China. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and has small, opposite leaves. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
